metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2885 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
An exploitable stack based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in theGNOME libsoup 2.58. A specially crafted HTTP request can cause a stackoverflow resulting in remote code execution. An attacker can send a specialHTTP request to the vulnerable server to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-soup-2.4 - 2.52.2-1ubuntu0.2
libsoup-gnome2.4-1 - 2.52.2-1ubuntu0.2
libsoup2.4-1 - 2.52.2-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsoup2.4 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.52.2-1ubuntu0.2').
